question.body: How do red blood cells transport carbon dioxide?

multiple_choice.choice: Most carbon dioxide binds to hemoglobin.
Carbonic anhydrase transforms most carbon dioxide into bicarbonate.
Carbon dioxide is transformed into carbonic anhydrase in the presence of bicarbonate.
Carbon dioxide is not transported through the cardiovascular system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Only about Â¼ of the carbon dioxide binds hemoglobin. Most is transported as bicarbonate.
Correct. Bicarbonate is very important in managing pH levels.
Incorrect. Carbonic anhydrase is an enzyme that functions to convert carbon dioxide to bicarbonate.
Incorrect. The cardiovascular system transports oxygen and nutrients, but just as important, it removes wastes.

part.hint: Recall the structure of hemoglobin and the chemical processes involving carbon dioxide.
